input.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Payroll Project Startup Script
# Opens 3 terminal tabs: frontend, backend, and claude command

# Check if gnome-terminal is available
if ! command -v gnome-terminal &> /dev/null; then
    echo "gnome-terminal not found. This script requires GNOME Terminal."
    exit 1
fi

# Open gnome-terminal with multiple tabs
gnome-terminal \
    --tab --title="Frontend" --working-directory="/repos/payroll" -- bash -c 'npm start; exec bash' \
    --tab --title="Backend" --working-directory="/repos/payroll/backend" -- bash -c 'npm run local; exec bash' \
    --tab --title="Claude" --working-directory="/repos/payroll" -- bash -c 'claude; exec bash'

echo "Payroll project started successfully!"
echo "3 terminal tabs opened:"
echo "- Tab 1: Frontend (npm start) in /repos/payroll"
echo "- Tab 2: Backend (npm run local) in /repos/payroll/backend" 
echo "- Tab 3: Claude command in /repos/payroll"

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Auto-start script for Payroll Project
# This script opens two terminal tabs and runs the required commands

# Source NVM to ensure npm is available
export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh"
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion"

cd /home/harshank/repos/payroll

# Open first terminal tab for frontend (npm start)
gnome-terminal --tab --title="Frontend" -- bash -c "
export NVM_DIR=\"\$HOME/.nvm\"
[ -s \"\$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh\" ] && \. \"\$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh\"
cd /home/harshank/repos/payroll && npm start; exec bash"

# Wait a moment then open second terminal tab for backend (npm run local)
sleep 2
gnome-terminal --tab --title="Backend" -- bash -c "
export NVM_DIR=\"\$HOME/.nvm\"
[ -s \"\$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh\" ] && \. \"\$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh\"
cd /home/harshank/repos/payroll/backend && npm run local; exec bash"

[ -s "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion"

gnome-terminal --tab --title="Frontend" -- bash -c "
export NVM_DIR=\"\$HOME/.nvm\"
[ -s \"\$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh\" ] && \. \"\$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh\"
cd /home/harshank/repos/payroll && npm start; exec bash"

content.text:
Done! Your custom command is ready at `/home/harshank/start-payroll.sh`. 

To use it, simply run:
```bash
./start-payroll.sh
```

The script will open 3 terminal tabs:
1. **Frontend tab**: Runs `npm start` in `/repos/payroll` 
2. **Backend tab**: Runs `npm run local` in `/repos/payroll/backend`
3. **Claude tab**: Opens `claude` command in `/repos/payroll`

All processes run in the background with `exec bash` to keep the terminals open after the commands finish.
